page.title: 03The Church in Kimpton
page.content: The Parish Church is Anglican and was first built in the 12th century.It is built of flint and extensive roof repairs are being done in 1985.About 35 adults and 25 children attend each Sunday .The Vicar is Rev.Denys R. Graebe. He lives at 11 High Street. On the village green there is a traditional-style Methodist Church built in 1870 in brick. Several extensions have been made and in 1985 major repair work is taking place. About 40 adults and 40 children attend each Sunday and there are midweek activities for young people,including Boys' Brigade and Youth Club.The Minister is Rev.Peter K.Bates who lives in Harpenden. All the denominations are exploring ways of working closer together.The Roman Catholics hold a weekly Mass in the Parish Church on Saturdays.
